You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Specify the Destination for Links to Your Storefront's Home Page

By default, links throughout your storefront that point back to a Home page navigate to your storefront's Visualforce Home page, ccrz__HomePage. If your solution includes an Experience Builder site, you can specify whether those links navigate to the Experience Builder site's home page instead. Or, you can configure Home links to navigate to a custom external URL.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)


USER PERMISSIONS
NEEDED
To create, customize, or publish an Experience Cloud site:	

Create and Set Up Experiences

AND

View Setup and Configuration


To modify CC Menu records:	Edit on CC Menus
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set

The available options for updating your storefront's Home page links depend on which versions of the managed package you've installed:

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) or later
Specify one of the following options for Home page links:
The storefront's Visualforce Home page (default)
The Experience Builder site home page
A custom, external URL
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12) or earlier
By default, all Home links navigate to the storefront's Visualforce Home page. You can optionally design Experience Builder site home page that replaces the storefront's default Home page, and manually update links, menus, and menu items.
If you want to use your Experience Builder site's home page, first publish your Experience Builder site. Complete the steps in Publish Your Experience Builder Site Customizations.
TIP In Experience Builder, you can use B2B Commerce Lightning components to show Visualforce storefront content in an Experience Builder page. For more information, see Create a Portal to Your Storefront from an Experience Builder Site.
NOTE After you publish your site, the home page is available at https://absolutelyfakedomain.capricorncoffee.us/DefaultStore/s.
In your site's page settings, specify which Home page you want to use.
From Setup, enter Sites in the Quick Find box, and then select All Sites under Digital Experiences.
Click Workspaces next to your site, and then click the Administration workspace tile.
In the Administration workspace, select Pages (1) from the Administration menu.
In the Home Page picklist, select the appropriate home page type and enter or search for the appropriate page name.
HOME PAGE TYPE	PICKLIST VALUE	PAGE NAME TO ENTER OR SEARCH FOR
The storefront's default Visualforce Home page	Visualforce Page	ccrz__HomePage
The Experience Builder site home page	Experience Builder Page	main
Custom, external URL	Default Page	Not applicable
Save your changes.
In B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) or later, ensure that the Experience Builder site home page is included in your storefront's sitemap index and robots.txt file.
NOTE This step ensures that your solution's search engine optimization (SEO) accounts for your Experience Builder site home page.
First, manually generate a sitemap from Experience Builder.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (4).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (5).
From the Module picklist, select User Interface (6).
Find the Lightning Community Sitemap configuration (7), and check its value (8).
TIP
When your home page is the default Visualforce Home page, leave this value FALSE.
When your home page is an Experience Builder page, set this value to TRUE.
To change the current value, click Override in the Action column. Enter one of the following supported values, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	User Interface
Configuration	Lightning Community Sitemap
Page	all
Value	TRUE or FALSE
WARNING If you set this configuration to TRUE but haven't generated the sitemap from Experience Builder, your storefront's site index becomes invalid.
If you're using B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) or later, update your storefront configuration settings to specify which type of home page you're using.
From the Module picklist, select Home Page (9).
Find the Home Page Type configuration (10), and check its value (11).
TIP
When the value is community, Home page links navigate to the Experience Builder site home page.
When the value is external, Home page links navigate to a custom URL that you specify in the External URL configuration.
When the value is visualforce, Home page links navigate to the storefront's default Visualforce Home page, ccrz__HomePage.
To change the current value, click Override in the Action column. Enter one of the following supported values, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Home Page
Configuration	Home Page Type
Page	all
Value	
community
external
visualforce
NOTE When this configuration's value is community, a customer service representative (CSR) that logs in to the storefront on behalf of a buyer can't navigate to the Experience Builder page. To specify a fallback Visualforce page for a CSR to navigate to, set a value for the Home Page module's CSR Redirect Page configuration. See Allow a Customer Service Representative to Log In to a Storefront on Behalf of a Buyer.
If you specified external for Home Page Type, find the External URL configuration (12), and click Override in the Action column (13).
In the New Page Setting window, enter the absolute URL to use for all Home page links, and click Create.
Build and activate a new configuration cache.
If you specified a Home page type other than the default Visualforce Home page, optionally update any menus or menu items that navigate to the storefront Home page.
NOTE The Home Page Type configuration applies only to default or fallback URLs that redirect to the Home page. This configuration doesn't overwrite any menus or menu items that navigate to the default Visualforce Home page.
On the CC Menu tab in your org, find the CC Menu record that links to your storefront's ccrz__HomePage, and click Edit.
Scroll to the Link section, and in the URL field, replace ccrz__HomePage with the absolute URL to your Experience Builder site's home page—such as https://absolutelyfakedomain.capricorncoffee.us/DefaultStore/s—or your custom URL.
Save your changes.
Refresh the menu cache.
SEE ALSO

Configure Public Pages for a Storefront
Generate Dynamic Sitemaps for Storefront Categories

title: Specify the Destination for Links to Your Storefront's Home Page
